title: Print, a bowl and a pitcher, ca. 1550
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: At top: a low, wide bowl decorated with fluting and mouldings. At bottom: the pitcher, with handel at right, in the form of a snake, making a figure 8. A mask beneath the lips, at left, On a wide, low pedestal.

participants.person_name: Jacques Androuet Du Cerceau the Elder

tombstone.epitaph: Print, a bowl and a pitcher, ca. 1550;  Jacques Androuet Du Cerceau the Elder (French, ca. 1515 - after 1584); France; paper; 12.5 × 6.3 cm (4 15/16 × 2 1/2 in.); Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane; 1945-59-20-8
